text.0: As we observe Veterans Day, note the connection between The Johns Hopkins Hospital and John McCrae, author of one of the most famous wartime poems of the 20th century. https://t.co/1qZ0P1owx4
text.1: 2-year-old Chloe was a happy and energetic kid until she suffered her first seizure. After trying 7 different medications and a lengthy steroid treatment, she was referred to Eric Kossoff at the @HopkinsKids #NationalEpilepsyAwarenessMonth https://t.co/aAVfFCNeyP
text.2: .@HopkinsMedicine researchers led by Zhaozhu Qiu have made a key discovery about a “gatekeeping” protein that may one day stop #stroke damage to #braincells. https://t.co/nTZrCPtAx9  https://t.co/q0LBY8A6sK https://t.co/9cp05HiSPo
text.3: "We worked closely with MDH's indoor testing working group and others to make sure that this site represents some of the highest standards and latest thinking on infection prevention," said Johns Hopkins expert James Ficke. https://t.co/XaYlwGzhim
text.4: Hetty Devroom had primary hyperparathyroidism. Head and neck surgeon ,Ralph Tufano, performed an operation that addressed the problem without leaving a scar on Hetty’s neck.https://t.co/QROzOtJ4aK
text.5: @GregCarrNeuro, @WarrickNeuro, @AdamKai and Sean Taverna are excited to be at #ABRCMS2020 this week! Stop by the @HopkinsMedicine virtual booth every night from 5:45-7:00p EST to learn more about what we do and how you can be a part of it.
text.6:
Some Baltimore restaurants are setting up tents to make it more comfortable for customers to sit outside. But is it actually safer than eating indoors?

The answer is usually no, says Dr. Morgan Katz, an assistant professor at @HopkinsMedicine. https://t.co/ZdzIgeqUdk
